column5: Crappies are much better in cold water too.

The easiest crappies to catch are when they spawn and of course that's when the water surface temp is in 70f.They still taste pretty good though I have no complaints.But pike have to come out of cold water. I never bring one home during mid summer.Usually mushy meat and a strong taste.Early spring at ice out and winter they are the best and late fall.

Weather here again ugly.-26 wirh wind.Good shack day.Got fishing around 8:30 was hoping to get there earlier but hasn't happened yet.Drilled one hole and got lucky with fish right away for about a good hour then fish just trickled I.Got a couple of dozen so good time.Didnt bother to get any freebie minnows today as minnow shack was locked up today and didn't want to bother anyone.That worked out good anyways since I've been tying up hair jigs.2 off them really performed today and have on another couple trips there.Looking forward to using them on the walleye opener soon.
Ummm, those fillets look so good!! Bill
Alot better coming out of 30 degree water VS. 70 degree water thats for sure !
Cold water fish definatly have a edge.especially pike.
They will be enjoyed Bill.Couple more weeks and season will close.
Coming the first so we don't have to test.
That's pretty good deal with no testing.I'll see if i can visit with you.Weather looking better. But right now you can go anywhere
